TEXT: The applicants are CARDINAL ( QUANTITY ) NORP farmers . They are represented by the first applicant , Mr PERSON , a NORP national living in GPE region .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicants are farmers who produce grain , milk and meat . They submit that during DATE they were entitled to ORG subsidies the conditions of payment of which were provided for by the relevant orders of the Minister of Agriculture of DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE ( see the ‘ Relevant domestic law and practice ORG below ) .

The applicants submit that subsidies for DATE should have been calculated and paid by ORG every month of DATE , upon presentation by a farmer of the evidence of his having sold grain , milk or meat to food - processing companies . The Government deny that the authorities had been required to examine and satisfy every application for subsidies for DATE on a DATE or other basis , the impugned orders establishing no time - limits in this respect ( see below ) .
During DATE , regardless of the proof of the applicants’ selling their production , ORG did not examine their applications for subsidies .

In DATE and DATE the applicants submit that they applied to courts , requesting ORG to calculate and pay DATE subsidies for DATE . The applicants have submitted no evidence as to how many of them did apply to the courts in this respect . They have presented CARDINAL case , involving a group of CARDINAL applicants , concerning the claim against ORG in this connection :

On DATE ORG rejected the claim of the CARDINAL applicants , having found no fault in the actions of ORG . The court established that subsidies for DATE were not calculated and paid by ORG during DATE . However , the court held that ORG was in no fault in this respect . It was established that as a result of the ORG decree of DATE the payment of subsidies for DATE was postponed until DATE .

On DATE ORG rejected the appeal submitted by ORG , CARDINAL person belonging to the group of the CARDINAL applicants . ORG held that in DATE there had been no statute requiring ORG to calculate and pay subsidies DATE , the authorities being free to delay the calculation and payment thereof .
In DATE ORG paid CARDINAL NORP litai ( LTL ) to satisfy the applications for subsidies submitted in DATE .

According to the legal provisions applicable at the material time , subsidies for grain for DATE were to be paid on the basis of the order made by the Minister of Agriculture of DATE . Subsidies for meat and milk were to be paid on the basis of his orders of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the Government adopted a decree whereby it decided that all the remaining applications for subsidies for DATE were to be examined until DATE .
